body.p:
Irvine Ky Jany 1st 1864
To His Excelency Thomas E. Bramlett
Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir

Some two weeks Since the Provost Marshal of this county mailed to you a certificate of the circuit clerk of this county Showing Presentments in this court against William Roggers for Robery & Treason & against James Roggers for Murder & Treason, with a request that you have said Roggers give up to the civil authorities for Trial or if that could not be done that they might be dealt with by military Law for their crimes & if name this could not be done that you would take some steps to prevent men who Stand indicted in our courts for such crimes from being taken in to the Federal Service and to carry Federal Bayonetts in this county whare they have committed those crimes the Marshal informs us that he has received no answer to said communication and Knows of no action being taken thare in. we the undersigned Loyal citizens of Estill county feeling that Such men ought not to be permitted to Escape punishment by Shielding themselves in this way ask and hope you will do whatever you can to have the requests of the Marshall to you carried our Immediately and that you will Inform us of what ever action may be taken at the earliest Possible moment

yours Respecfy
C. C. Bell
